comments.body: I was under the impression this was intentional so you couldn't just use creepers for mining. I'd be interested if anyone could confirm or deny that.
Yup needs adding along with coordinates when you die.
Creepers are hostile mobs.  This feature would allow them to be used like tools, which I don't think is a good idea.

Agree, but only works with player placed blocks. For example, if one were to blow up in your house, the blocks you placed to make your house would drop every block placed by a player, but naturally generated blocks not placed by a player would still drop as they used to do. So you could rebuild the damage of your house, but you could not use creepers as a tool for mining, as not all ores broken would get dropped.

I literally need this
I lost a stack of coal before because of a creeper explosion, and I never have enough dirt to properly fill up creeper holes.
Just no. That's the point. The fact that you dont get 100% of the blocks back is an intended feature.

Its the most annoying thing in the game in my opinion. I don't care if they explode my stuff if I don't have to remake half the blocks in my wall.

Maybe, to get a truly pacifist ending, you could have to complete these objectives:

  • Jump into the end without any weapons in your hotbar or off-hand item. (These weapons would include swords, axes, bows, arrows, potions that can harm, tridents, etc.)
  • Don't die. (Duh)
  • Don't destroy any ender crystals.
  • Don't hurt any enderman or the ender dragon.
  • Throw splash potions of healing at the ender dragon.

After you throw at least 2 splash potions of healing at the ender dragon, the dragon will come down to where the portal is, and the dragon egg will appear when it leaves. Then you must throw 1 splash potion of healing onto the egg. The dragon will then come back down, but it and the enderman will no longer want to hurt you, unless you hurt any one of them. The dragon floats over the egg, and soon, a baby ender dragon crawls out. It would be very small and every single entity in the end will stare at you and you're health and hunger will be boosted all the way up and you will receive an elytra, and maybe an exclusive new end item like a picture that will always be a picture of the ender dragon with its baby or a dragon scale sword enchanted with 'Heart of the End' that could make any enderman around you not attack you and attack whatever you attack. The portal will open and you can jump through back to the overworld and the scene that usually shows up will praise you for protecting the last of the ender dragon kind.

This all sounds a bit weird. Why does everything have to be complicated. Out of all of the cruel things in this game you choose beating the final boss to be the worst? Like is anyone going "oh no, I dropped bowser into a pit of lava and he suffered a painful death. He had a son and everything I feel like the real villain." Like they're pixels. When I read a peaceful ending I was thinking like you win the game without killing any hostile mobs and don't do anything that the game detects as cruel. Not killing the final boss
This is bull crap. If you don't like killing stuff, play one of those pet games or whatever.

We don't really know that the ender dragon is innocent. I believe that the endermen accidentally summoned it while trying to make a portal and that thing came out. It absorbed their soul energy, thus taking on their colors and gaining access to their minds. The endermen were once an intelligent species but now they are reduced to mindlessness. The advancement for beating the ender dragon is "free the end", implying that the dragon was harming the dimension.

Also this is just ridicules. If you feel bad killing it just don't kill it, and don't go to the end. There's nothing in game that points you too completing the game (imagine how far you'd get without YouTube, you'd never even reach the nether!).
Make sure to also see what other ideas I came up with if you're interested.

There are ways to remove enchantments entirely (mainly by combining two of them in your crafting grid), but I hope you mean that you want to be able to take an enchantment off an item and put it on a book so you can put it on another item.

Even though the idea of disenchanting items and being able to place in on other weapons feels way too OP, mostly because the fishing rod has the most mending and taking mending off of the rod would let you easy enchant your other tools, I think it should stay as it is.

The item would be worked on with an unenchanting table, the interface would be the same as the enchanting table but with a list of the enchantments that can be removed. The unenchanting table would be most useful with enchantments that are not mutually exclusive to other enchantments, like removing efficiency from a shovel.
We already had this choice. Remember the useless phantom mob? Yeah you people chose that over being able to manipulate enchantments
I think you will be able to do this in 1.14 update, and it will also give xp back

First of all, I agree with this idea. It could work like...


A) If you use an anvil, and put a book in the first slot and the unwanted enchanted item in the second. The book will only take the top enchantment, and you have to use more books to get more (1 enchantment, one book. 2 enchantments, 2 books. If its enchanted Sharpness II, Looting I, and Unbreaking III, and you only use two books, you get a book with the enchantments Sharpness II and Looting I). You also lose the item that was enchanted, as a kind of balancing tool. Wrong enchantment on a Diamond Sword or want it on a different sword? Lose the diamond. Using this, however, you can take off the enchantments of chain armor or golden swords that you get from mobs. Or, you could even not lose out if you don't have diamond tools and armor yet, and don't have access to books, and not lose out if you enchant your current iron tools. (I prioritized enchanting over tools and armor). Another balancing option is to have it only work if you have the durability higher than a certain percent (only possible if above 50%, 75%, or only if it is at 100%).

 

B) A new block. Using this you can get all enchantments in their own respective books. You would still need books, but you could also get the original item back. However, it takes away 50% of the max durability. If your durability depletes completely, you lose the item and the enchantments. Once again, for balancing issues.

 

C) A new functionality to the Blacksmith. You can already enchant weapons using the blacksmith, so why not remove them using him? Using a larger amount of emeralds than enchanting, and also trading some books, you could disenchant the items. 

 

D) A Wondering Trader trade. We all know of the wondering trader that is in the newest snapshot. While right now his trades are kind of useless, in the future, based on his spawn rates, will have really good trades. maybe only he can disenchant the item, just like the blacksmith above. That way you still hold on to the enchanted item for a long time, and by the time you find him, you may or may not have the enchanted item with you and enough emeralds to make the trade. 

 

Just a thought. I really want this functionality added, so please listen and review this functionality. If you want more Why, How, or What to this idea, let me know!
I agree with WoodierBean option A
this could be the smithing table's functionality.

I like this. There should be a naturally generated quicksand. You have to do a block hack to make quicksand now. And it does not work exactly like quicksand. It will not let you sink All the way.

I'm thinking maybe you could also craft quicksand by placing sand, clay, and a water bottle in the grid. Quicksand could behave pretty much like powdered snow, only instead of a freezing effect, you suffocate if your head stays in quicksand for too long. If just your legs are in quicksand, you don't take damage. Maybe it could have a similar texture to mud and it could be used as an alternative for powdered snow in surprise pitfall traps.

This may make a great addition for the Wild Update.

Dear Minecraft Team,
I think it could add several benefits to the game:
• More interesting desert biomes:
Quicksand would make deserts more varied
and challenging.
• New traps: Players could build simple
but creative traps that are easy to
understand and use especially for new
players.
• Realistic and educational aspect: Quicksand
could be designed so that players sink faster
when moving and slower when staying still.
This would also have an educational effect,
especially for younger players, by teaching
them how real quicksand works in nature.

I believe quicksand would fit naturally into Minecraft and open up exciting new gameplay possibilities.

In case you're wondering how to change your name here, it's a bit tricky. First, go to microsoft's website and sign in. Then, go to your profile and edit your name. After that, log out and back in at feedback.minecraft.

Is there a way to change your username?

What you are suggesting is to remove the minimum character limit in Java Edition, which would do nothing but devalue the 1-2 character usernames. As somebody who has met many players with 2 character usernames and has a particular interest in rare names and the community behind them, I find the implementation of this idea very unfair for the people who "earned" those usernames. It looks like you and the people that upvoted this are simply jealous of the owners of these very valuable accounts and just can't deal with the fact there are some things you will never get to have. Just deal with it!

Also, what you said about it being a feature until 2016 is false. You were only able to create an account or reserve a name with 1-2 characters when the game was new (around 2010). The account "8" was created in early 2015, simply because the user already had the username reserved at the very early stages of the game.

Guys, there's no reason not to have an option to disable autosave. We had it before for console and we can have it again. Your "But, this! And but, that!" Is easily solved by restricting the save or mode to something that isolates it from other players who join or whatever multiplayer exists. It's 2021. Figure it out. Progress is freedom, not restriction. Our worlds are our paintings and we want the ability to play without scrapping old copies each time we do. Copying over and over is annoying either way. Give us the freedom to sketch and scrap without copying.

I started playing Minecraft with my wife in split screen on ps4 because it's one of only a handful of games we can play together without having to buy another PS4 and television.

The game being exited by force while autosave is occurring causes the entire world file to corrupt and become unusable. This can result in hours, days, weeks, or even months of undue lost progress simply because of, say, a power outage that occurred with unfortunate timing. The only advice anybody can give is to use an uninterruptible power supply to ensure that the game can't be interrupted while saving... Which is known to be able to damage the system.

Either Autosave needs to be brought back as a feature, or automatic backup saves that occur in addition to the main save need to be implemented.

It is absolutely intolerable to lose days, weeks, or months of progress due to an unfortunate occurrence that can happen at literally any time, and it's infuriating how little the devs care about the userbase to have not even implemented a safeguard of some kind to prevent this exact scenario from happening.

I legitimately cannot enjoy the game because the irremovable presence of autosave presents a permanent risk of losing everything that I and my wife have worked for in-game at any possible second.

WOW this has been here since 2020? Thats insane! Do the devs really not see autosaves constant major lag spikes as a big problem? Cause seriously, you cant honestly think its not causing you to lose any players

It was so stupid of them to remove this awesome feature, I loved it when i could just turn off autosave and build to my heart's content, and to never worry about griefers, because what harm could they do if it could just be easily reversed.

I'm definitely noticing the fps drops because of the autosave which happens both too frequently and too little at the same time, all in all i would much rather it be disabled, and am I the only one who is also noticing it in the public official servers such as the hive as well? Either way there has got to be a way for us to be able to disable it regardless it causes more annoyance than it ever being helpful period.
